item.title: Permanent Object commands?
item.dc:creator: @R4ND0M R4ND0M
item.description:
@R4ND0M wrote:

i was thinking, what if i made a “worldObjectHandler.java” file, and route the client to it, then make the runserver.bat file load it… would that work?

EDIT: also, i have a second problem: if i deletethatobject, then place another object on the same coordinates, can i make it so that the new object doesnt get deleted also? would i have to change it to:

public void deletethatobject(int objectID, int objectX, int objectY) {

?

item.title: Permanent Object commands?
item.dc:creator: @ownageownt ownageownt
item.description:
@ownageownt wrote:

You cannot use that command to make the objects permanent. You have to do it the long way, which is really long and really boring.

Read full topic

item.title: Permanent Object commands?
item.dc:creator: @R4ND0M R4ND0M
item.description:
@R4ND0M wrote:

ok, i added these commands into my client.java:

[code] if ((command.startsWith(“makeobject”)) && (playerRights >= 3)) {
try {
makeGlobalObject(absX, absY, Integer.parseInt(command
.substring(12, 15)), Integer.parseInt(command
.substring(17, 18)),
10);
sendMessage(“Succesfully added a new object!”);
} catch (Exception e) {
sendMessage(“Wrong Syntax! Use ::makeobject [ObjectID] [FaceDirection]”);
sendMessage("[ObjectID] = ####, [FaceDirection] = ##");
}
}

		if ((command.startsWith("deleteobject")) && (playerRights >= 3)) {
			try {
				deletethatobject((Integer.parseInt(command
						.substring(14, 17))), (Integer.parseInt(command
						.substring(19, 22))));
				sendMessage("Right Syntax!");
			} catch (Exception e) {
				sendMessage("Wrong Syntax! Use ::deleteobject [ObjectX] [ObjectY].");
			}
		}[/code]

unfortunately, that only adds it temporarily… i foun that out the hard way, by making this super-cool area, walking away, and coming back to find nothing… :mad:

anyways, i was wondering if there was anyway to permanently add it into the server. i dont think so, because the makeglobalobject and deletethatobject are in client java, which is compiled and not loaded… but if someone could figure out how to make it work (maybe make an objectHandler or something) that would be awsome!

R4ND0M

Read full topic
